p: Besides the “natural” risk of an emergence of a certain zoonosis that is directly linked to pathogen evolution (i.e.: change in pathogenicity) and ecology (e.g., extreme weather events, natural catastrophies, climate change) , more cryptic threats exist and are a cause of concern: the possibility of zoonotic emergence from xenotransplantation from an infected animal biological product (Allan 1996) and the deliberate release of infectious agents into human or animal populations by people (Atlas 2001).
